sen.j: 上湯温泉（かみゆおんせん）は、奈良県吉野郡十津川村（旧国大和国）にある温泉。
sen.e: Kamiyu Onsen Hot Spring (Kamiyu Onsen) is a hot spring in Totsukawa-mura, Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture (the former Yamato Province).
Kamiyu Onsen Hot Spring (Kamiyu Onsen) is a hot spring in Totsukawa-mura, Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture (the former Yamato Province).
Kamiyu Onsen Hot Spring (Kamiyu Onsen) is a hot spring in Totsukawa-mura, Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture (the former Yamato Province).

sen.j: 車 五條市・新宮市から国道168号、十津川村平谷蕨尾（ワラビ尾交差点）より国道425号経由、奈良県道735号龍神十津川線。
sen.e: By car Take National Route 168 from Gojo City or Singu City, or take Ryujin-Totsukawa Route of Nara Prefectural Road, via National Route 425 from Hiraya Warabio, Totsukawa-mura village (warabio crossing).

By car: Take National Route 168 from Gojo City or Singu City, or take Ryujin-Totsukawa Route of Nara Prefectural Road, via National Route 425 from Hiraya Warabio, Totsukawa-mura village (Warabio intersection).

By car: Take National Route 168 from Gojo City or Singu City, or take Ryujin-Totsukawa Route of Nara Prefectural Road, via National Route 425 from Hiraya Warabio, Totsukawa-mura village (Warabio intersection).

sen.j: バス 近畿日本鉄道大和八木駅、西日本旅客鉄道五条駅 (奈良県)、JR新宮駅より奈良交通（八木新宮線、十津川線） - 「十津川温泉」停留所で十津川村営バス（上湯川線、寺垣内線）に乗換 - 「小原口」停留所下車
sen.e: By bus Take Nara Kotsu Bus Lines (Yagi-Shingu Route, Totsukawa Route) from Yamato-Yagi Station of Kinki Nippon Railway Company, Gojo Station of West Japan Railway Company (Nara Prefecture), or JR Shingu Station, and transfer to Totsukawa Village Bus (Kamiyukawa Route, Teragaito Route) at the bus stop, `Totsukawa Onsen Hot Spring' and get off the bus at the bus stop, `Ohara entrance.'

By bus: Take Nara Kotsu Bus Lines (Yagi-Shingu Route, Totsukawa Route) from Yamato-Yagi Station of the Kinki Nippon Railway Company, Gojo Station of the West Japan Railway Company (Nara Prefecture), or JR Shingu Station, and transfer to Totsukawa Village Bus (Kamiyukawa Route, Teragaito Route) at the bus stop of `Totsukawa Onsen Hot Spring' and get off the bus at the bus stop of `Ohara entrance.'
sen.cmt: 鉄道路線に定冠詞theを付与
sen.e: By bus: Take Nara Kotsu Bus Lines (Yagi-Shingu Route, Totsukawa Route) from Yamato-Yagi Station of the Kinki Nippon Railway Company, Gojo Station of the West Japan Railway Company (Nara Prefecture), or JR Shingu Station, and transfer to Totsukawa Village Bus (Kamiyukawa Route, Teragaito Route) at the bus stop of `Totsukawa Onsen Hot Spring' and get off the bus at the bus stop of `Ohara entrance.'
Sodium bicarbonate spring
Sodium bicarbonate spring

One Japaneses Inn, Kamiyuso Inn
A Japanese-syle inn, Kamiyuso Inn
A Japanese-syle inn, Kamiyuso Inn

sen.j: 上湯川沿いに神湯荘の露天風呂がある。
sen.e: There is an open-air spa of Kamiyuso Inn along kamiyukawa River.
There is an open-air spa of Kamiyuso Inn along the kamiyukawa River.
sen.cmt: kamiyukawa River に定冠詞the を付与
sen.e: There is an open-air spa of Kamiyuso Inn along the kamiyukawa River.

sen.j: 上湯川には河原を掘ると温泉が湧く場所（野湯）がある。
sen.e: A hot spring spot (野湯) can be found by drilling the river side of kamiyukawa River.
sen.cmt: （野湯）→定訳不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: A hot spring spot (野湯) can be found by drilling the river side of kamiyukawa River.
A hot spring spot (野湯) can be found by drilling the river side of kamiyukawa River.

sen.j: 2軒の民宿 民宿かわうそ(休業中) 民宿ふかせ
sen.e: Two Minshuku (private home that runs inn providing room and board) Minshuku Kawauso (be closed for business), Minshuku Fukase
Two Minshuku (private home that runs inn providing room and board): Minshuku Kawauso (be closed for business), Minshuku Fukase
Two Minshuku (private home that runs inn providing room and board): Minshuku Kawauso (be closed for business), Minshuku Fukase

sen.j: 上湯川沿いに、公衆浴場つるつるの湯がある。
sen.e: There is a public bath, Tsurutsuru no yu along kamiyukawa River.
There is a public bath, Tsurutsuru no yu along the kamiyukawa River.
sen.cmt: kamiyukawa River に定冠詞the を付与
sen.e: There is a public bath, Tsurutsuru no yu along the kamiyukawa River.

sen.j: 開湯は享保年間と言われる。
sen.e: It is said that the bath was opened during the Kyoho era.
It is said that the bath was opened in the Kyoho era.
It is said that the bath was opened in the Kyoho era.

sen.j: 1985年（昭和60年）3月19日、温泉地温泉、十津川温泉とともに国民保養温泉地に指定。
sen.e: On March 19, 1985, it was designated as a People's Recreation Spa along with Tosenji Onsen Hot Spring and Totsukawa Onsen Hot Spring.
On March 19, 1985, it was designated as a People's Recreation Spa along with Tosenji Onsen Hot Spring and Totsukawa Onsen Hot Spring.
On March 19, 1985, it was designated as a People's Recreation Spa along with Tosenji Onsen Hot Spring and Totsukawa Onsen Hot Spring.

sen.j: 2004年6月28日、十津川村役場が、村内の温泉の「100%源泉掛け流し宣言」を発表した。
sen.e: On June 28, 2004, Totsukawa-mura village office declared that hot springs within Totsukawa-mura village are` 100% free-flowing hot-spring.'
On June 28, 2004, Totsukawa-mura village office declared that hot springs within Totsukawa-mura village are` 100% free-flowing hot-spring.'
